intro: Macaranga densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered mallow, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its alternate, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on peduncles. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Macaranga densiflora is also noted for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
